etymology.description: Depicts a net, resembling the structure of interconnected ropes
etymology.interpretation: 𦉎(𦉎) (wǎng, "net") is an ancient pictogram that visually represents the structure of a net, with crisscrossing lines symbolizing the ropes or cords used to form nets.

examples.chinese: 渔夫修补了他的𦉎(漁夫修補了他的𦉎)，准备用来捕鱼(準備用來捕魚)。
examples.pinyin: Yúfū xiūbǔ le tā de wǎng, zhǔnbèi yòng lái bǔ yú。
examples.english: The fisherman repaired his net and was ready to catch fish.

examples.chinese: 孩子们在海边玩耍时(孩子們在海邊玩耍時)，用沙子做成一个小小的𦉎(用沙子做成一個小小的𦉎)。
examples.pinyin: Háizimen zài hǎibiān wánshuǎ shí, yòng shāzi zuòchéng yī gè xiǎoxiǎo de wǎng。
examples.english: While playing at the seaside, the children made a small net out of sand.

examples.chinese: 古人使用𦉎(古人使用𦉎)，捕捉珍稀鱼类(捕捉珍稀魚類)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔrén shǐyòng wǎng, bǔzhuō zhēnxī yúlèi。
examples.english: Ancient people used nets to catch rare fish.
